metadata.name: Ensure that Service Account Tokens are only mounted where necessary (Manual)
metadata.description: Service accounts tokens should not be mounted in pods except where the workload running in the pod explicitly needs to communicate with the API server
metadata.rationale: Mounting service account tokens inside pods can provide an avenue for privilege escalation attacks where an attacker is able to compromise a single pod in the cluster. Avoiding mounting these tokens removes this attack avenue.
metadata.audit:
Review pod and service account objects in the cluster and ensure that the
option below is
set, unless the resource explicitly requires this access.
```
automountServiceAccountToken: false
```
metadata.remediation: Modify the definition of pods and service accounts which do not need to mount service account tokens to disable it.
metadata.impact: Pods mounted without service account tokens will not be able to communicate with the API server, except where the resource is available to unauthenticated principals.
metadata.default_value: By default, all pods get a service account token mounted in them.
